sentences.sContent: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
sentences.sCn: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了，实际上我们从小就认识。

sentences.sContent: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
sentences.sCn: 其实再想想，我今晚不打算出去了。

sentences.sContent: ...which could be why fewer people in that group actually made it to that point...
...I’ve actually just learned of this concept myself...
...Students who put off their work until the last moment often find the exams more difficult than they actually are...
...I think text messaging actually is what you have to do with your age...
...We wanted to give people an opportunity to actually see the calories before they purchased the food and make a decision and inform decision...
...countries that overcut forests actually do better than those that preserve their forests...
...but actually the rules of gift-giving vary quite a lot...

words.tran: 真实的，实际的；现行的，目前的
成为现实；发挥出潜力（等于actualize）
实行；使成现实；发挥出…的潜力

trans.tranOther: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation
